segments.text: Jim , I heard you took a trip to San Diego . Is that right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , I just got back this morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That sounds really nice . What did you do there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , we were only there for three days , so we didn't do too much . We went shopping and went out to dinner a few times . And at night we walked around the city with some friends .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I have them with me . Do you want to look at them ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sure , I love looking at photos .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: This one is of my wife and me on the beach , and this one is our daughter Emily standing next to my wife .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Your daughter looks like her mother .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know , they look very similar .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That was taken at the train station before we left .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you have time to go to the zoo ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , not this time . We went there last time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It looks like you all had a nice time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , it was a lot of fun .
segments.speaker: S2
